709943f-a.title: Manhattan: 7th Avenue - Central Park South
709943f-a.text:
Seventh Avenue, adjoining and at the S. 9. corner of
Central Park South (W. 59th St.J, showing pavement condi-
tion relative to subway construction here. To the left
are buildings occupied by the Central Park Riding Academy.
The Seventh Avenue entrance to Central Park is at the right.
Note the crosstown street car on Central Park South. This
thoroughfare is actually W. 59th Street, changing it's name
where it borders the Park.
June 4, 1915.
Borough President of Manhattan
MAY BE REPRODUCED
No. 668

718437f-b.title: Manhattan: Central Park West - Broadway
718437f-b.text:
1 \& 2
Central Nark Nest (rioht) and Broadway (left), north
from Columbus Circle (W. 59th St.), showing buildings to
the west of Central Park. The latter is at the right and
the entrance to same partially shown. Note the Maine
Eonument there. The triangular two-story structure in the
center is the American Circle Building. This divides
the thoroughfares and stands on the former site of the old
Baltimore S Ohio Railroad Station. To the rear of same
is W. 60th Street. North of this and facing the Park is
the Mayflower Hotel (erected 1921). The twin-towered
Century Apartuents shown in view 8, replaced the old Century
Theatre, a portion of which appears in the earlier photo.
Geographically, Central Park West, is Eighth Avenue, an
idenhity it resumes, south of this point, and north of
11(th Street.
March 11, 1929
March i9, 1938
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

718435f.title: Manhattan: 59th Street (West) - 7th Avenue
718435f.text:
170-160 Central Park South (West 59th Street) adjoining the S.E.
corner of Seventh Ave., showing the site of the 45-story Essex House being
cleared. Photographer is viewing southward through clearance ard shows

September 14, 1928.

Cift of Albert A. Volk Co.
